• This response is also now required by South African legislation and policy. The Domestic Violence Amendment
Act (2021) says that health workers should be given the skills and tools to respond to IPV among patients.
Maternal Perinatal and Neonatal Health Policy states that IPV prevention and response is an “essential life-
saving intervention.” Health workers have a responsibility to identify abuse, do a safety risk assessment (see
